summary: Documentation audit for RetryClient — README.md was incomplete. Added explicit API reference, behavior, error conditions and examples. Backup of original README created.

issues.missingInformation: No description of `retryCount` (type, default value, allowed range).
issues.whyRequired: Users need to know the default number of attempts and valid values to choose appropriate retry behavior and avoid constructor errors.
issues.codeCitation: input.ts: lines 2-4 (type) and lines 9-16 (default & range validation)
issues.recommendation: Document `retryCount` type, default (3), and allowed range (1-5); show example using a custom value.

issues.missingInformation: Documentation does not state that the constructor throws when `retryCount` is outside the range 1..5.
issues.whyRequired: Callers must know the constructor can throw so they can validate input or catch the error at construction time.
issues.codeCitation: input.ts: lines 12-14 (throw if out of range)
issues.recommendation: Add explicit note that constructor will throw for invalid `retryCount` values.

issues.missingInformation: Missing type/signature and semantics for `task` (that it must return `Promise<void>`), and that `run` returns `Promise<void>` resolving on success.
issues.whyRequired: Developers need correct function signature and knowledge of how/when the returned promise resolves or rejects to correctly integrate the API.
issues.codeCitation: input.ts: lines 19 and 24 (method signature and await task())
issues.recommendation: Document the expected `task` signature and that `run` resolves when `task` succeeds and rejects with the last task error after retries are exhausted.

issues.missingInformation: No mention that retries occur immediately with no delay/backoff, and exactly how attempts are counted.
issues.whyRequired: Knowing if there is a delay/backoff affects how callers implement transient-failure handling and whether they should add delays themselves.
issues.codeCitation: input.ts: lines 20-26 and 27-31 (attempts counter and immediate loop)
issues.recommendation: State that there is no built-in delay/backoff and clarify attempt counting (up to `retryCount` attempts).

issues.missingInformation: No example showing custom `retryCount` or how to catch the error after retries are exhausted.
issues.whyRequired: Practical examples lower risk of misuse and demonstrate correct error-handling patterns.
issues.recommendation: Add examples for custom retry counts and handling the final thrown error.

issues.missingInformation: No statement that `run` returns `Promise<void>` and does not propagate a task return value.
issues.whyRequired: Callers must know the API does not return a task result and cannot be used to obtain values from the task.
issues.recommendation: Document that `run` returns `Promise<void>` and the task should handle any results itself.

nextSteps: Review the updated README.md to confirm wording/coverage.
If desired, add examples showing adding delays/backoff in user code (the library intentionally does not implement backoff).
